img.title: Reef-Sunset Unified School District Featured Image

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.strong: Reef-Sunset Unified School District Board of Trustees Selects:

span.p: Avenal, Calif. (April 17, 2020) – The Reef-Sunset Unified School District (RSUSD) Board of Trustees is pleased to announce that Pat Sánchez has been selected as the new Superintendent. The Board voted unanimously to approve Mr. Sánchez’s appointment at the April 16th regular board meeting. He is scheduled to begin his position on July 1, 2020.

Input for the new superintendent included sessions with administrators and staff, a community open forum for parents and district stakeholders, and an online survey. Using this information, Leadership Associates, a top search firm, conducted an extensive search. The Board selected Pat Sánchez from an incredibly talented and impressive list of candidates.

Pat Sánchez brings to Reef-Sunset Unified School District more than 24 years of comprehensive administrative experience and a proven track record of leading the transformation of four inner city schools, one inner city school district, and one suburban school district through student-centered collaborative leadership and community engagement.

Superintendent Sánchez is committed to enabling a “student-serving” culture, and building strong parent-community ties. He views shared leadership and collaboration as essential elements to empowerment and excellence for all children.

Superintendent Sánchez strives to make a difference in the lives of people, and his hard work has been widely recognized at the highest levels. He was named Latino Superintendent of the Year by the Association of Latino Administrators and Superintendents (ALAS) in 2014. Former President Obama recognized him in 2015 as a Champion of Change, which included an invitation to the White House to share ideas and insights. Former U.S. Secretary of Education Arne Duncan applauded Superintendent Sánchez with national recognition for his collaborative work, and encouraged replication of his model of supporting parental involvement and engendering community support across the country. Recently, he was recognized as the Region 6 Superintendent of the Year (2019) by the Association of California Administrators.

Prior to coming to Reef-Sunset Unified School District, he served for four years as the Superintendent at Newark Unified School District, working to improve academic outcomes as well as re-establish budgetary reserves and internal controls. In collaboration with FCMAT, he focused on addressing the challenges faced by a district with seven years of declining enrollment.

Prior to this work, he served as Superintendent for four years of Adams County School District, Colorado’s 26th largest school district serving more than 7,500 students annually. There, nearly 90 percent of students qualified for free and reduced lunch, about 87 percent of the students were children of color, and approximately 55 percent of the students were English-language learners. In this role, Superintendent Sánchez implemented numerous reforms to transform this historically low-performing district. Through addressing racial educational disparities, providing access to culturally-responsive learning environments, and implementing powerful instructional strategies to facilitate seamless English-language acquisition, he spearheaded meaningful changes to create an environment of high expectations for students. In addition, he advanced efforts to re-establish trust between the staff and community.Throughout his career, Superintendent Sánchez has demonstrated a deep commitment to working with traditionally marginalized students in inner city schools. His extensive educational background includes time spent as a central office administrator in Human Resources, principal of three high schools, principal of one middle school, and other key leadership roles. He also served as a Career and Technical Education Teacher, State Director of the Vocational Industrial Clubs of America, and Assistant State Director for Trades and Industry for the Colorado Community College system. Superintendent Sánchez also worked in Central America for the American School of Guatemala as a secondary principal and transportation director.

Of personal significance, Superintendent Sánchez’s rich background speaks to his deep-rooted understanding of the value of higher education. As the son of parents from Amalia, New Mexico and San Luis, Colorado, he is the youngest of eight children and the first person in his family to graduate from college and to receive a graduate degree. He earned a Bachelor of Arts in secondary industrial science, a Career Technical Education Credential and a general education license from Colorado State University. Spanish was his first language. He obtained a vocational instructor license in construction trades and in the automotive and diesel industry. Superintendent Sánchez completed his Master of Arts in administration, supervision and curriculum development at the University of Colorado, and he went on to obtain his professional principal and superintendent license credentials.
In his free time, Superintendent Sánchez enjoys travel, spending time with his two children, hunting, fishing, and the outdoors.

When asked how he feels about being the sole finalist for Reef-Sunset Unified School District, he said, “I feel humbled and honored to serve Reef-Sunset School District students and the community. I very much look forward to meeting everyone!”

a.title: Go to comments for Reef-Sunset Unified School District Board of Trustees Selects: Pat Sánchez as Superintendent

p.span: Estimada Comunidad de RSUSD,

El primero de Abril, el Gobernador y superintendente de Escuelas hicieron la sugerencia pública que escuelas deben de mantenerse cerradas el resto del año escolar 2019-2020. Discutieron la transición de aprendizaje lejano y alternativas de calificaciones para estudiantes en la secundaria.

Reef Sunset Unified en conjunto con otros distritos del Condado de Kings hemos considerado el impacto de cerrar escuelas con la epidemia del virus COVID-19. El distrito está preparado para cerrar y proveer educación usando un modelo de aprendizaje lejano y
p.strong: estaremos cerrados hasta el 11 de Agosto, 2020
p.span: si el departamento de salud pública lo permite.

Estaremos repartiendo computadora para uso en casa para los estudiantes de la primaria el 14 de Abril. Servicios de comida continuarán después de Spring Break (semana santa) pero vamos a modificar como se da esa comida. Empezando el 14 de Abril, solamente estaremos dando comida una vez a la semana pero daremos comida para toda la semana (cinco días). Estas acciones serán para asegurar la seguridad de nuestros estudiantes y nuestros empleados. Escuela operará vía la internet, y otro variedad de métodos. Por favor contacten al maestro/maestra de sus hijos o Principal para más información. Por favor visiten nuestra pagina de web o sitios sociales como facebook e instagram de sus escuelas o distrito para la información más reciente.
Gracias por su paciencia y apoyo en estos tiempos.
David East, Ed.D.
Superintendent
Dear RSUSD Community,

On April 1st, 2020, the Governor and Superintendent of Public Instruction made statements suggesting that schools in California would remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. They discussed transitions to Distance Learning and alternatives for grading available for high school students.

Reef-Sunset Unified has worked with other Kings County School Districts to review the impacts of school facility closures within the context of the COVID-19 virus pandemic. The District is ready to move to Distance Learning models and
p.strong: will close school facilities until August 11th,
p.span: 2020 provided that the County Public Health Department has given us guidance to do so.

We will be able to provide Chromebooks for home use to the remainder of elementary grades on April 14th. Food Services will modify the delivery of meals to one time per week with meals prepared for the entire week.

These actions are taken in order to provide safety for our students and staff. School will operate online via a variety of methodologies. Please contact your child's Teacher or Principal should you have questions. Please check our website regularly and "like" district and school Facebook and Instagram pages for the latest information.
Thank you for your continued patience and support.
David East, Ed.D.
Superintendent

a.title: Go to comments for School Facilities Update

p.span: Notice of Extended School Facility Closure
27 de marzo de 2020 ~ 9:00 AM

br.span: Comunidad del Condado de Kings:
A principios de este mes, los superintendentes de los distritos escolares del Condado de Kings, con el apoyo de
sus respectivas mesas directivas y en consulta con el departamento de salud pública local, se tomó la decisión
de cerrar temporalmente nuestras escuelas debido al brote del COVID-19. Desde entonces, hemos permanecido
en contacto constante entre las diferentes agencias, vigilando los y anuncios nacionales que afectan a nuestras
escuelas. Durante los cierres, nos hemos centrado en proporcionar a los estudiantes con comidas,
oportunidades de enriquecimiento educativo y planificación de la educación a distancia. Inicialmente planeamos
regresar a instrucción tradicional en el salón de clase en abril, prometiendo evaluar continuamente la situación.
Como líderes, estamos encargados de hacer todo lo que podamos para responder a la declarada
Emergencia estatal y nacional. Tenemos en cuenta la reciente orden del gobernador de "refugiarse y
mantenerse en lugar" y la orientación sostenida para practicar la socialización a distancia.
El Dr. Milton Teske, Oficial de Salud del Departamento de Salud Pública del Condado de Kings, aconseja que
nuestra comunidad necesita seguir centrándose en la contención , y una parte importante de ese esfuerzo es
mantener las instalaciones de la escuela cerradas. Mirando hacia el futuro, podemos identificar los criterios que
necesitarían ser cumplidos antes de que la escuela se regrese a sesiones en salón de clase. Estos incluyen el
levantamiento de la orden estatal de "refugiarse y mantenerse en lugar" y la eliminación de las directivas de
distanciamiento social y restricciones a las reuniones sociales.
Dadas las circunstancias actuales, hemos llegado a la decisión colectiva de que la seguridad de nuestras familias
y nuestras comunidades pesan más que todas las demás consideraciones. Reconocemos la necesidad de
extender el cierre de nuestras instalaciones físicas hasta el 1 de mayo de 2020. Nos enfocaremos en
proporcionar comidas a nuestros estudiantes y en la educación a través de la enseñanza a distancia.
Continuaremos evaluando las circunstancias siempre cambiantes, esperando que la instrucción en el salón de
clase se vuelva a reiniciar el 4 de mayo de 2020.
Los padres deben contactar con las oficinas del distrito local o con las escuelas para obtener información
específica relacionada con sus respectivas escuelas. Por favor, sigan la dirección y la guía de los
administradores de sus escuelas con respecto a las medidas que están tomando para
el beneficio de todos.
Gracias por su apoyo y comprensión en nuestros esfuerzos por mantener nuestras comunidades seguras.
Sinceramente,
Los Superintendentes en el Condado de Kings
Kings County Community:
Earlier this month, Kings County school district superintendents, with the support of their boards of trustees and in
consultation with the local public health department, made the decision to temporarily close our schools due to the
COVID-19 outbreak. Since then, we have remained in constant contact with one another, monitoring local, state
and national announcements that affect our schools. During the closures, we have focused on providing students
with meals, educational enrichment opportunities, and planning for distance learning. We initially planned to
resume classroom instruction in April, promising to continually evaluate the situation.
As leaders, we are charged with doing everything we can to respond to the declared state and national
emergency. We heed the governor’s recent “shelter in place” order and the sustained guidance to practice social
distancing.
Dr. Milton Teske, Health Officer for the Kings County Department of Public Health, advises that our community
needs to continue to focus on containment , and an important part of that effort is keeping school facilities closed.
Looking ahead, we can identify criteria that would need to be met before school resumes normally. These include
the lifting of the statewide “shelter in place” order and the removal of the guidelines for social distancing and
restrictions on social gathering.
Given these current circumstances, we have come to a collective decision that the safety of our families and our
community outweigh all other considerations. We recognize the need to extend the closure of our physical sites
until May 1, 2020. Our focus will be on providing meals to our students and education through distance learning.
We will continue to evaluate the ever-changing circumstances, remaining hopeful classroom based instruction will
resume on May 4, 2020.
Parents should contact their local district offices or school sites for specific information related to their schools.
Please follow the direction and guidance from your school administrators regarding measures they are taking for
the benefit of all.
Thank you for your support and understanding in our efforts to keep our communities safe.
Sincerely,
The Superintendents of Kings County:

a.title: Go to comments for Extended School Site Closures

p.span: FOOD SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT
Estimados Padres,

Como ya saben que las escuelas del distrito escolar Reef-Sunset permanecerán cerradas hasta el 14 de abril debido al brote de COVID-19. Las escuelas proveerán desayuno y almuerzos a partir del martes, 17 de marzo en las siguientes escuelas.
Avenal Elementary School - 11:00am - 12:00 pm (Al frente de la cafetería)
Kettleman City Elementary School - 11:00am - 12:00 pm (al lado del carril del autobús)
Miércoles y después- estos sitios adicionales estarán disponibles para recoger comida.
Tamarack Elementary School - 11:00am - 12:00 pm
Los padres deben de identificar a sus hijos y el sitio de su escuela, cualquier estudiante puede recoger una comida.

Por favor visite nuestro sitio web www.rsusd.net para obtener la información más reciente sobre el cierre de escuelas y las oportunidades de aprendizaje para su hijo. Nuestra situación ha cambiado a diario. Es importante que escuche el teléfono y consulte nuestro sitio web con frecuencia.

a.title: Go to comments for Food Service Announcement Spanish

div.span: As you know, Reef-Sunset Schools will be closed until April 14th due to the COVID-19 outbreak. Reef-Sunset Schools will provide free breakfast and lunch meals to-go beginning Tuesday March17th at the following schools:
Avenal Elementary School - 11:00am - 12:00 pm (in front of cafeteria)
Kettleman City Elementary School - 11:00am - 12:00 pm (next to the bus lane)
Wednesday and thereafter - these additional sites will be available for food pick up.

Please visit our website www.rsusd.net for the latest information regarding school closures and learning opportunities for your child.Our situation has been changing daily. It's important that you listen to telephone and check our website frequently.

a.title: Go to comments for Food Service Announcement

p.span: esta es una situacion dificil pero necesaria, mientras intentamos de prevenir el contagio de el coronavirus. El distrito

br.span: escolar de RSUSD sirve a estudiantes de todos niveles y tenemos la responsabilidad no solo para educar
pero tambien para proteger a nuestros estudiantes. Esperamos que el cierre de las escuelas sea solo por un poco tiempo.
La informacion sobre el cierre de las escuelas llego a nuestra atencion por el departamento de salud, ellos nos aconsejaron
que la mejor accion a este momento es de cerar las escuelas. Estamos explorando maneras en las cuales los estudiantes
puedan continuar con su aprendisaje durante el tiempo que las escuelas permanezcan cerradas. Cualquier eventos escolares
ya sean deportes, practicas, paseos escolares, actividades de competiciones academicas tambien seran canceladas o
reorganizadas para una fecha futura. El bien estar y la salud de nuestros estudiantes es nuestra prioridad. Como les
mencionamos anteriormente, no es una decision facil. Por favor de referir a nuestro sitio web www.RSUSD.org
para mas informacion y detalles. Muchas gracias por su comprendimiento y apollo durante esta crisis nacional.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19(Corona Virus) Update - SPANISH

p.span: This is a difficult decision, but necessary, as we try to slow the spread of the virus. RSUSD schools serve

br.span: students at all levels of need and we have a responsibility to not only educate, but protect our children.
We are hopeful that these closures remain short term and do not continue to be extended, but that guidance
comes from the department of health and is somewhat out of our hands. We are also exploring ways in which
students can continue their learning during this time though technology when and if closures are extended.
Along with the closure of school and classes, any and all athletic contests and practices, academic team
practices, field trips, events, activities, and school functions are cancelled or postponed through
April 14, 2020. Those restrictions may be extended beyond that date even if school resumes that day or
prior. The safety of our students is our top priority. Again, this is not an easy decision and not one we
take lightly. Please refer to our website at www.RSUSD.org for updates and details. Thank you for your
understanding and support during this time of national crisis.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19(Corona Virus) Update
